blocks.content: The value of the step function ` E ` for Euclid's Algorithm on an ordered pair. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 31-Mar-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2014.)

thm eucalgval2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0)), wceq(co(c0, c2, c1), cif(cop(c0, c1), cop(c1, co(c0, cmo, c1)), wceq(c1, nat0))))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, cn0, cn0, cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  ovmpt2a(s0, s1, c0, cn0, c1, cn0, c2, cif(cop(c0, c1), cop(c1, co(c0, cmo, c1)), wceq(c1, nat0)), cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)))
  ifbieq12d(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), cop(c0, c1), cop(c1, co(c0, cmo, c1)), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), c1)), wceq(cv(s1), nat0), wceq(c1, nat0))
  eqeq1d(cv(s1), nat0, c1, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), c1)))
  opeq12(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1), c1)
  opeq12d(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1)), c1, co(c0, cmo, c1), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), c1)))
  simpr(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), c1))
  oveq12(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1), c1, cmo)
  ifex(cop(c0, c1), cop(c1, co(c0, cmo, c1)), wceq(c1, nat0))
  opex(c0, c1)
  opex(c1, co(c0, cmo, c1))
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
  diff.cif.s(s0, cop(c0, c1), cop(c1, co(c0, cmo, c1)), wceq(c1, nat0))
  diff.cop.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.cop.s(s0, c1, co(c0, cmo, c1))
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cmo, c1)
  diff.cmo.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, c1, nat0)
  diff.nat0.s(s0)
  diff.cn0.s(s1)
  diff.cif.s(s1, cop(c0, c1), cop(c1, co(c0, cmo, c1)), wceq(c1, nat0))
  diff.cop.s(s1, c0, c1)
  diff.cop.s(s1, c1, co(c0, cmo, c1))
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, cmo, c1)
  diff.cmo.s(s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, c1, nat0)
  diff.nat0.s(s1)
}

thm eucalgval2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ0)→(c0[c2]c1)= if(c1 = 0, < c0, c1 >, < c1,(c0[mod]c1)>))
  ⊣ c2 =(s0 ∈ ℕ0, s1 ∈ ℕ0 ↦ if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
} = {
  ovmpt2a(s0, s1, c0, cn0, c1, cn0, c2, if(c1 = 0, < c0, c1 >, < c1,(c0[mod]c1)>), if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>))
  ifbieq12d(< s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>, < c0, c1 >, < c1,(c0[mod]c1)>, (s0 = c0 ∧ s1 = c1), s1 = 0, c1 = 0)
  eqeq1d(s1, nat0, c1, (s0 = c0 ∧ s1 = c1))
  opeq12(s0, c0, s1, c1)
  opeq12d(s1, (s0[mod]s1), c1, (c0[mod]c1), (s0 = c0 ∧ s1 = c1))
  simpr(s0 = c0, s1 = c1)
  oveq12(s0, c0, s1, c1, cmo)
  ifex(< c0, c1 >, < c1,(c0[mod]c1)>, c1 = 0)
  opex(c0, c1)
  opex(c1, (c0[mod]c1))
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
  diff.cif.s(s0, < c0, c1 >, < c1,(c0[mod]c1)>, c1 = 0)
  diff.cop.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.cop.s(s0, c1, (c0[mod]c1))
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cmo, c1)
  diff.cmo.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, c1, nat0)
  diff.nat0.s(s0)
  diff.cn0.s(s1)
  diff.cif.s(s1, < c0, c1 >, < c1,(c0[mod]c1)>, c1 = 0)
  diff.cop.s(s1, c0, c1)
  diff.cop.s(s1, c1, (c0[mod]c1))
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, cmo, c1)
  diff.cmo.s(s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, c1, nat0)
  diff.nat0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: eucalgval
blocks.content: Euclid's Algorithm ~ eucalg computes the greatest common divisor of two nonnegative integers by repeatedly replacing the larger of them with its remainder modulo the smaller until the remainder is 0. The value of the step function ` E ` for Euclid's Algorithm. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 31-Mar-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm eucalgval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)), wceq(cfv(c1, c0), cif(c0, cop(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cmo, c0)), wceq(cfv(c2nd, c0), nat0))))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpo(s0, s1, cn0, cn0, cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  3eqtr4d(cfv(c1, c0), cif(c0, cop(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cmo, c0)), wceq(cfv(c2nd, c0), nat0)), cfv(c1, cop(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0))), cif(cop(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0)), cop(cfv(c2nd, c0), co(cfv(c1st, c0), cmo, cfv(c2nd, c0))), wceq(cfv(c2nd, c0), nat0)), wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)))
  syl5eqr(cfv(c1, cop(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0))), cif(cop(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0)), cop(cfv(c2nd, c0), co(cfv(c1st, c0), cmo, cfv(c2nd, c0))), wceq(cfv(c2nd, c0), nat0)), co(cfv(c1st, c0), c1, cfv(c2nd, c0)), wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)))
  df-ov(cfv(c1st, c0), c1, cfv(c2nd, c0))
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)), wceq(co(cfv(c1st, c0), c1, cfv(c2nd, c0)), cif(cop(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0)), cop(cfv(c2nd, c0), co(cfv(c1st, c0), cmo, cfv(c2nd, c0))), wceq(cfv(c2nd, c0), nat0))), wcel(cfv(c1st, c0), cn0), wcel(cfv(c2nd, c0), cn0))
  xp1st(c0, cn0, cn0)
  xp2nd(c0, cn0, cn0)
  eucalgval2(s0, s1, cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0), c1)
  fveq2d(c1, c0, cop(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0)), wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)))
  ifeq12d(c0, cop(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cmo, c0)), cop(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0)), cop(cfv(c2nd, c0), co(cfv(c1st, c0), cmo, cfv(c2nd, c0))), wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)), wceq(cfv(c2nd, c0), nat0))
  opeq2d(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cmo, c0), co(cfv(c1st, c0), cmo, cfv(c2nd, c0)), wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cmo, c0), co(cfv(c1st, c0), cmo, cfv(c2nd, c0)), cfv(cmo, cop(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0))), wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)))
  fveq2d(cmo, c0, cop(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(c2nd, c0)), wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)))
  1st2nd2(c0, cn0, cn0)
  df-ov(cfv(c1st, c0), cmo, cfv(c2nd, c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1st, c0)
  diff.c1st.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c2nd, c0)
  diff.c2nd.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c1st, c0)
  diff.c1st.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c2nd, c0)
  diff.c2nd.s(s1)
}

thm eucalgval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0)→(c1 ` c0)= if((2nd ` c0)= 0, c0, <(2nd ` c0),(mod ` c0)>))
  ⊣ c1 =(s0 ∈ ℕ0, s1 ∈ ℕ0 ↦ if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  3eqtr4d((c1 ` c0), if((2nd ` c0)= 0, c0, <(2nd ` c0),(mod ` c0)>), (c1 ` <(1st ` c0),(2nd ` c0)>), if((2nd ` c0)= 0, <(1st ` c0),(2nd ` c0)>, <(2nd ` c0),((1st ` c0)[mod](2nd ` c0))>), c0 ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  syl5eqr((c1 ` <(1st ` c0),(2nd ` c0)>), if((2nd ` c0)= 0, <(1st ` c0),(2nd ` c0)>, <(2nd ` c0),((1st ` c0)[mod](2nd ` c0))>), ((1st ` c0)[c1](2nd ` c0)), c0 ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  df-ov((1st ` c0), c1, (2nd ` c0))
  syl2anc(c0 ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0), ((1st ` c0)[c1](2nd ` c0))= if((2nd ` c0)= 0, <(1st ` c0),(2nd ` c0)>, <(2nd ` c0),((1st ` c0)[mod](2nd ` c0))>), (1st ` c0)∈ ℕ0, (2nd ` c0)∈ ℕ0)
  xp1st(c0, cn0, cn0)
  xp2nd(c0, cn0, cn0)
  eucalgval2(s0, s1, (1st ` c0), (2nd ` c0), c1)
  fveq2d(c1, c0, <(1st ` c0),(2nd ` c0)>, c0 ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  ifeq12d(c0, <(2nd ` c0),(mod ` c0)>, <(1st ` c0),(2nd ` c0)>, <(2nd ` c0),((1st ` c0)[mod](2nd ` c0))>, c0 ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0), (2nd ` c0)= 0)
  opeq2d((2nd ` c0), (mod ` c0), ((1st ` c0)[mod](2nd ` c0)), c0 ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  syl6eqr((mod ` c0), ((1st ` c0)[mod](2nd ` c0)), (mod ` <(1st ` c0),(2nd ` c0)>), c0 ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  fveq2d(cmo, c0, <(1st ` c0),(2nd ` c0)>, c0 ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  1st2nd2(c0, cn0, cn0)
  df-ov((1st ` c0), cmo, (2nd ` c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1st, c0)
  diff.c1st.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c2nd, c0)
  diff.c2nd.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c1st, c0)
  diff.c1st.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c2nd, c0)
  diff.c2nd.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: eucalgf
blocks.content: Domain and codomain of the step function ` E ` for Euclid's Algorithm. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 31-Mar-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2014.)

thm eucalgf(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wf(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0), cxp(cn0, cn0))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpo(s0, s1, cn0, cn0, cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpbi(wf(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0), cxp(cn0, cn0)), wral(s0, cn0, wral(s1, cn0, wcel(cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), cxp(cn0, cn0)))))
  rgen2a(s0, s1, cn0, wcel(cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), cxp(cn0, cn0)))
  mpjaodan(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn0)), wcel(cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), cxp(cn0, cn0)), wcel(cv(s1), cn), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))
  adantlr(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn), wcel(cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), cxp(cn0, cn0)))
  eqeltrd(cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), cxp(cn0, cn0), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn)))
  iffalsed(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn)), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))
  neneqd(cv(s1), nat0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn)))
  adantl(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn), wne(cv(s1), nat0))
  nnne0(cv(s1))
  opelxpd(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1)), cn0, cn0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn)))
  adantl(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn), wcel(cv(s1), cn0))
  nnnn0(cv(s1))
  sylan(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn), wcel(co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1)), cn0), wcel(cv(s0), cz))
  nn0z(cv(s0))
  zmodcl(cv(s0), cv(s1))
  eqeltrd(cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), cxp(cn0, cn0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn0)), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)))
  adantl(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn0)), wceq(cv(s1), nat0), wceq(cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  iftrue(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))
  adantr(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn0)), wceq(cv(s1), nat0), wcel(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cxp(cn0, cn0)))
  opelxpi(cv(s0), cn0, cv(s1), cn0)
  sylib(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn0)), wo(wcel(cv(s1), cn), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), wcel(cv(s1), cn0))
  simpr(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(cv(s1), cn0))
  elnn0(cv(s1))
  fmpt2(s0, s1, cn0, cn0, cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), cxp(cn0, cn0), c0)
  diff.cxp.s(s0, cn0, cn0)
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
  diff.cxp.s(s1, cn0, cn0)
  diff.cn0.s(s1)
}

thm eucalgf(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 :(ℕ0 × ℕ0)→(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  ⊣ c0 =(s0 ∈ ℕ0, s1 ∈ ℕ0 ↦ if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpbi((c0 :(ℕ0 × ℕ0)→(ℕ0 × ℕ0)), ∀(s0 ∈ ℕ0, ∀(s1 ∈ ℕ0, if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>)∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))))
  rgen2a(s0, s1, cn0, if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>)∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  mpjaodan((s0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ s1 ∈ ℕ0), if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>)∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0), s1 ∈ ℕ, s1 = 0)
  adantlr(s0 ∈ ℕ0, s1 ∈ ℕ0, s1 ∈ ℕ, if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>)∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  eqeltrd(if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>), (ℕ0 × ℕ0), < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>, (s0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ s1 ∈ ℕ))
  iffalsed(< s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>, (s0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ s1 ∈ ℕ), s1 = 0)
  neneqd(s1, nat0, (s0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ s1 ∈ ℕ))
  adantl(s0 ∈ ℕ0, s1 ∈ ℕ, s1 ≠ 0)
  nnne0(s1)
  opelxpd(s1, (s0[mod]s1), cn0, cn0, (s0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ s1 ∈ ℕ))
  adantl(s0 ∈ ℕ0, s1 ∈ ℕ, s1 ∈ ℕ0)
  nnnn0(s1)
  sylan(s0 ∈ ℕ0, s1 ∈ ℕ, (s0[mod]s1)∈ ℕ0, s0 ∈ ℤ)
  nn0z(s0)
  zmodcl(s0, s1)
  eqeltrd(if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>), (ℕ0 × ℕ0), < s0, s1 >, ((s0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ s1 ∈ ℕ0)∧ s1 = 0))
  adantl((s0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ s1 ∈ ℕ0), s1 = 0, if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>)= < s0, s1 >)
  iftrue(< s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>, s1 = 0)
  adantr((s0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ s1 ∈ ℕ0), s1 = 0, < s0, s1 > ∈(ℕ0 × ℕ0))
  opelxpi(s0, cn0, s1, cn0)
  sylib((s0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ s1 ∈ ℕ0), (s1 ∈ ℕ ∨ s1 = 0), s1 ∈ ℕ0)
  simpr(s0 ∈ ℕ0, s1 ∈ ℕ0)
  elnn0(s1)
  fmpt2(s0, s1, cn0, cn0, if(s1 = 0, < s0, s1 >, < s1,(s0[mod]s1)>), (ℕ0 × ℕ0), c0)
  diff.cxp.s(s0, cn0, cn0)
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
  diff.cxp.s(s1, cn0, cn0)
  diff.cn0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: eucalginv
blocks.content: The invariant of the step function ` E ` for Euclid's Algorithm is the ` gcd ` operator applied to the state. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 31-Mar-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm eucalginv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cxp(cn0, cn0)), wceq(cfv(cgcd, cfv(c1, c0)), cfv(cgcd, c0)))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpo(s0, s1, cn0, cn0, cif(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cop(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cmo, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {

blocks.name: eucalg
blocks.content: Euclid's Algorithm computes the greatest common divisor of two nonnegative integers by repeatedly replacing the larger of them with its remainder modulo the smaller until the remainder is 0. Theorem 1.15 in [ApostolNT] p. 20. Upon halting, the 1st member of the final state ` ( R `` N ) ` is equal to the gcd of the values comprising the input state ` <. M , N >. ` . This is Metamath 100 proof #69 (greatest common divisor algorithm). (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 31-Mar-2011.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2014.)
